page.title: 01MANSFIELD WOODHOUSE
page.content: { Mansfield Woodhouse}lies to the north of{Mansfield}and has a{population of {well over 24 000.}The village was not mentioned in the{Domesday Book}but Mansfield was noted to have the following people. Five Freemen,35 villages,20 smallholders and 2 priests. Woodhouse, however, has evidence of settlement since{Roman {times.}The Romans had a large camp on {Whinney Hill}and in 1786{Hayman Rooke excavated two villas in{Pleasley Vale. Iron was worked here in{Medieval {times,}but by the{19th century}coal had become the main employer. Nowadays,there are several large housing estates and regular bus services to{Mansfield,Sutton and {Warsop.}A new service runs to{Wellow bringing customers to the new{Co-op {Superstore,}opened in 1984. {Class 7 St.Edmund's C.E. Primary.
